summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The emails coordinate agent availability and travel plans for the operation, which is being managed by the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to Epstein's island
events.description: FBI agents from New York plan to fly out on an FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island.

events.title: Planned return travel for FBI agents
events.description: The FBI agents conducting the search of Epstein's island are scheduled to return home, contingent on the search taking 1-3 days.

keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) in New York was planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas.
The search warrant affidavit was being drafted by the SDNY (Southern District of New York) and was expected to be sworn out on Friday in St. Thomas.
The search operation was planned to be managed by the FBI's ERT (Evidence Response Team) and was estimated to take 1-3 days.
The email correspondence shows active, high-priority planning for this investigative action in early August 2019.
All sender/recipient names in the email chain are redacted, indicating internal FBI communication.
